title: Drawing, "Winter, the Forge of the Vulcan, Spring, the Bath of Venus, Summer Feasts of Bacchus and Ceres", ca. 1790
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: l'inverno, fuoco, o Volcano; Bagno di Venere; Feste di Bacco e Cerere
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vulcan forging arrows which are collected by putti.  Venus standing in circular basin served by putti. One of putti points backward where warrior appears. Landscape with part of circular temple.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Winter, the Forge of the Vulcan, Spring, the Bath of Venus, Summer Feasts of Bacchus and Ceres", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2253.
